job.title: Customer Success Specialist
job.description:
AppVault specializes in groundbreaking recruitment software solutions providing a holistic approach to engaging, hiring, and retaining talent. We take steps to fully understand a client’s culture, messaging, and brand to provide cutting-edge recruitment SaaS based solutions to leading B2B brands around the country. 

Our mission is to proactively support organizations by creating and distributing strategic multi-channel messaging to highly targeted audiences – communicating unique qualities and identifying the right candidates. Our team is comprised of dedicated and coordinated professionals – analysts, creators, supporters, and leaders – proficient in multitasking and committed to delivering. 

About the Opportunity

The Customer Success Specialist will work closely with the Customer Success Manager to ensure all client deliverables are met and client satisfaction is sound across all accounts. To execute this, the CSS will become familiar with our technology and various tasks such as ad management, media implementation, product upsells, data presentation, customer communication, and issue resolution, to name a few.
  • Support CSM in day-to-day client communication via email and phone calls 
  • Manage execution of client deliverables ranging from Creative to Media to Strategy by partnering with the applicable internal and external teams
  • Present and implement monthly client media plans and product upsells
  • Present performance data bi-monthly to clients
  • Media implementation throughout the month as client needs arise
  • Become comfortable leading client conference calls and client-facing meetings 
  • Support CSM in QBR or year-end meeting preparation
  • Become comfortable participating with new business pitches
  • Occasional travel involved
  • Assistance with new client onboarding
  • Endless opportunities – we are growing, join us! 

What You’ll Bring to the Table

  • The CSS identifies as a proactive, detail-oriented problem-solver that thrives in a fast-paced work environment and isn’t afraid of day-to-day challenges. If you are a collaborative go-getter who wants to be a customer advocate and partner closely with a scaling team to drive customer success, this is a great opportunity for you.
  • Minimum of 1-2 years of client-facing experience preferred
  • BA/BS Bachelor’s degree
  • Diligent prioritization skills, strong multi-tasker & ability to adapt to constantly changing and unexpected deadlines
  • Highly organized, strong prioritization skills, and detail-oriented
  • Ability to learn new platforms and processes quickly
  • Obtain a solid understanding of our product offerings and how they benefit our clients’ recruitment strategies
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office

What We’ll Bring to the Table

We know you have a life outside of your job. That’s why we offer some great benefits. In addition to health insurance, 401K, and unlimited paid time off; we offer a hybrid work schedule, employee discounts, professional support, and the chance to work with some great people. 

EOE M/F/D/V

job.title: Sales Associate
job.description:
Core Responsibilities:

  • Cold Calling Verified Prospect Lists
  • Appointment Setting
  • Hosting Introduction Calls & Online Presentations
  • Qualifying Prospects
  • Scheduling Follow Up Calls with Sales Team

Job Overview


AppVault is looking for a Sales Associate to act as the liaison between our Marketing & Sales teams. Your role will be to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers.

To be successful in this role, you must actively communicate with HR (Human Resources) leaders. You will need to use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you successfully transition the opportunity with the sales team.

If you are self-motivated and results-driven, and enjoy working in a team environment, we would like to meet you. As a Sales Associate, your role will help boost sales opportunities and contribute to our long-term business growth. Below is a summary of your day-to-day responsibilities:
  • Proactively Seek New Business Opportunities
  • Research and Qualify Companies as Potential Sales Opportunities
  • Contact Potential Clients Through Cold Calls and Emails
  • Deliver Targeted Messaging Specific to AppVault’s Suite of Recruitment Technology
  • Presenting Our Company with Targeted Product Messaging to Potential Clients
  • Build Long-Term Trusting Relationships with Clients
  • Set Up Meetings or Calls Between Qualified Prospects and Sales Team
  • Report to the Sales Team on Weekly Performance
  • Stay Up to Date with New Products/Services and New Pricing/Payment Plans

Requirements

  • Excellent Phone, Writing, and Listening Skills
  • Knowledge of Business Processes and Organizational Structures
  • Hands-On Experience with Multiple Sales Techniques
  • Experience with CRM (Customer Relationship Management) Software
  • Familiarity with Power Point and MS Excel
  • Understanding of Sales Performance Metrics
  • Interest in Recruitment Marketing Technology
  • BS degree in Marketing, Business Administration or Relevant Field

Desired qualifications:

  • At Least 6 Months or Similar Experience Reaching or Exceeding Scheduling Activity Goals/Quotas
  • Familiarity with Recruitment Marketing Technology
  • Basic understanding of Talent Acquisition and general Recruitment process.

About AppVault

AppVault is a recruitment marketing technology and media services company. Our mission is to help companies hire more efficiently and effectively by humanizing the candidate experience.
  • Reach Your Target Audience
  • Engage Qualified Candidates
  • Connect & Nurture Relationships
  • Hire The Best Employees

job.title: Executive Assistant
job.description:
Do you have deep experience supporting a very high-level executive? Are you known for keeping your cool under pressure? Can you interact with the most senior levels of management? If you’re nodding your head, then a Senior Executive Support Professional position at AppVault might be right for you.


Our Senior Executive Support Professionals are highly-respected because their skills are quite simply, essential. You’d be a key member of a dynamic, fast-paced team that is reinventing the recruitment industry and would work with some of the most creative, intelligent people in the business. Join us – apply today!


This position currently reports to Jen Beck – President & General Manager. You would be responsible for supporting Jen on a day-to-day basis. Our team runs AppVaults' executive relations, interacting with brands like Coca-Cola and Walmart. As well, we manage the business teams that support them including analytics, business development, digital revenue, and operations. It goes without saying that there will be expense reports, travel planning, hundreds of phone messages and endless calendar jockeying, but this job is very much about people. The relationship you form with the executive you support is absolutely critical, because that’s what enables you to become a true partner.


Responsibilities

Every day as an Executive Support Professional is different!

On any given day you might:

  • Create a multi-city travel itinerary, taking into account time zones, weather delays, traffic and fatigue levels
  • Interface directly with other senior executives and their support teams – your ability to work well with people on all levels is a very important part of your job
  • Review your leader’s schedule to build-in time for things like thinking and travelling to their next meeting
  • Understand the day’s priorities so you can be strategic about how you direct phone calls
  • Schedule conference rooms, meetings and video chats
  • Be ready to throw the entire schedule out the door when an emergency comes up, then pick it up again when the dust settles
  • Handle extremely confidential, sensitive information, remembering that our clients are publicly traded companies
  • Draft letters and emails on behalf of your leaders
  • Assist with on-boarding new employees – you’ll be the “friendly face” that newbies count on to answer all their questions, including some who are extremely senior in the organization
  • Collect information, conduct research, fact-check existing work and prepare regular reports and summaries – you’ll have tasks that you “own” completely and will provide regular assistance on others
  • Manage large purchase orders
  • Mentor and train younger support professionals in hard skills like computer programs, and soft skills like teamwork
  • Plan large, high-profile events like premiers, product launches, off-sites and team-building activities

Basic Qualifications

  • At least 6 years supporting a Vice President and/or equivalent experience directly supporting an Executive
  • Sharp written and verbal communication skills, including flawless grammar and a rich vocabulary
  • Desire to immerse yourself fully and learn all aspects of your executive’s business
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize deadlines/deliverables
  • Strong proficiency with all types of computers, phones and office equipment, as well as mastery of Microsoft Office programs, SAP, Confluence and Concur
  • A calm head and steady hand to deal with the unexpected
  • “EQ” skills to build bridges, forge alliances and encourage people to want to work with you
  • Complete reliability handling confidential, often highly sensitive information
  • Desire to truly be helpful to your leaders and co-workers, to go the extra mile without being asked
  • Some flexibility in your schedule – we value work/life balance, but in a pinch, a bit more time is needed
  • Very strong organizational skills and extreme attention to detail and
  • A highly professional demeanor, positive outlook and a can-do attitude

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience at TMP or comparable agency
  • Experience working with large public corporations and
  • Good knowledge of media and/or consumer technology

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent experience

Preferred Education

  • Master’s degree

Additional Information

  • Paid time off, 401K participation, a retirement savings plan, discounts on a wide variety of offerings, medical/dental/vision insurance and educational reimbursement-just to name a few

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.description:
AppVault is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our growing team. AppVault is a growing company with an entrepreneurial spirit, and we are always striving to develop the next great technology solution in the recruiting space. If you have a passion for developing great software, we need you.

The Senior Software Engineer is not only a first-class software engineer but is also able to perform code and documentation reviews, and mentor other developers. The ideal candidate would also be familiar with public cloud technologies, specifically on the Azure platform. The candidate is also a great communicator, and able to convey technical information to business stakeholders.

Responsibilities

  • Establish, refine and integrate development and test environment tools and software as needed
  • Identify production and non-production application issues
  • Identify opportunities to fine-tune and optimize applications of .NET developed projects
  • Provide technical support and consultation for .NET application and infrastructure questions
  • Serve as a mentor to less experienced developers

Basic Qualifications

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related
  • 5+ years of experience with the .Net development stack, including C#, Asp.Net, .Net MVC, SQL Server, and Windows Server 2008 R2-2016
  • JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, Html5 and responsive front-end development
  • Object Oriented Analysis and Design
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment with multiple projects
  • Strong analytical, project planning and decision-making skills
  • Proficient in specifying and evaluating architecture requirements

Preferred Qualifications

  • Master’s degree in computer science, or engineering
  • Node.js
  • React
  • Application hosting on the Azure platform

AppVault LLC is a full-service recruitment and marketing company with 25+ years of experience. We focus on employee recruitment advertising and engagement. Our team is comprised of dedicated and coordinated professionals, analysts, creators, developers, support staff and leaders who are proficient in multitasking and committed to delivering. Our corporate headquarters in Atlanta offers a cool, high-tech work environment, including a Moroccan style room to help get creative juices flowing as well as shuffleboard, ping-pong and foosball for stress relief. Satellite offices are in Denver, Seattle, Orlando and Ireland. While our niche is recruitment advertising, we also provide software solutions designed to engage potential candidates, communicate with current and former employees, and develop relationships using emerging mobile, social and CRM platforms. Forward thinking partnerships lead to innovative ideas that constantly push our creative juices and product solutions. AppVault also offers a competitive salary and great benefits that include health, dental, vision and 401(k).

job.title: Digital Product Manager
job.description:
Our product development team is committed to developing innovative products that are recruitment SaaS based solutions to leading B2C and B2B brands around the country and in several industries.

AppVault Specializes in groundbreaking recruitment software solutions providing a holistic approach to engaging, hiring and retaining talent through the use job board technology and database optimization via CRM platforms. With this role we are looking for self-motivated individual with a digital software background, that will work with our senior level product managers who will help them grow into a product manager role.

As a Digital Product Manager, your responsibilities will include:

  • Conducting market and business analysis that outlines problems, opportunities, and solutions
  • Meeting with stakeholders to effectively gather, document, and communicate critical information to cross-functional teams
  • Performing user acceptance testing
  • Sharing ideas and findings with teams
  • Working closely with the Lead Project Manager on various planning activities, deliverables, and timelines
  • Using Agile processes and templates for capturing and detailing requirements
  • Working with the UI/UX architect to create and update UI mockups (includes occasionally creating wireframes to communicate needs)
  • Working closely with the team throughout the development process to ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements
  • Evaluating user enhancement requests, creating user stories, maintaining the product backlog, and contributing to the product roadmap
  • Acting as a liaison between the software development team and others in the organization through regular communication and training sessions

What We Need from You:

  • 2 years of experience as a Product Manager, Software Product Owner, or Business Analyst
  • Experience managing web application and software technology projects
  • Strong technical writing skills
  • Superb communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to explain complex ideas simply.
  • Exceptional organizational and time management skills
  • Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle
  • Experience working in an Agile environment and utilize management tools such as Jira or Azure DevOps
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
  • Curiosity and loads of energy and excitement
  • Empathy for end-users and customers
  • The desire to make a great product even better and more competitive

These Are Awesome Too!

  • Experience in HR and Talent Acquisition
  • Experience working with offshore software development teams
  • Familiarity with Azure DevOps

job.title: Analyst
job.description:
AppVault specializes in groundbreaking recruitment software solutions providing a holistic approach to engaging, hiring, and retaining talent. We take steps to fully understand a client’s culture, messaging, and brand to provide cutting-edge recruitment SaaS based solutions to leading B2B brands around the country.

Our mission is to proactively support organizations by creating and distributing strategic multi-channel messaging to highly targeted audiences – communicating unique qualities and identifying the right candidates. Our team is comprised of dedicated and coordinated professionals – analysts, creators, supporters, and leaders – proficient in multitasking and committed to delivering.

About the Opportunity

The Analyst is an integral part of the team through supporting Customer Success and Product teams with various reporting needs such as data visualization, manipulation, presentation, and encompassing multiple data metrics. The Analyst will help report on metrics related to paid media campaigns for our clients as well as Product performance.

  • Create and oversee implementation of client dashboards
  • Provide technical expertise to identify and resolve any issues with campaign tracking and/or reporting
  • Assist Customer Success with monthly, quarterly and year-end client presentations
  • Provides supplemental reporting and analysis as applicable
  • Clean or augmenting data as needed
  • Ensuring the completeness and accuracy of all data
  • Be comfortable participating in client conference calls and in-person meetings as needed
  • Become an expert in AppVault’s technology offerings, potentially participating with new business pitches
  • Endless opportunities – we are growing, join us!
  • Occasional client-facing meetings and travel involved

What You’ll Bring to the Table

The Analyst identifies as a proactive, detail-oriented problem-solver that thrives in a fast-paced work environment and isn’t afraid of day-to-day challenges. If you are a collaborative go-getter who wants to be a customer advocate and partner closely with a scaling team to drive customer success, this is a great opportunity for you.
  • Minimum of 2 years of Analyst experience
  • BA/BS Bachelor’s degree
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office, Data Studio and/or Power BI
  • Understanding of SQL
  • Diligent prioritization skills, strong multi-tasker & ability to adapt to constantly changing and unexpected deadlines
  • Experience working with a team
  • Obtain a solid understanding of our product offerings and how they benefit our clients’ recruitment strategies

What We’ll Bring to the Table

We know you have a life outside of your job. That’s why we offer some great benefits. In addition to health insurance, 401K, and paid time off, we offer a hybrid work schedule, employee discounts, professional support, and the chance to work with some great people.

EOE M/F/D/V

job.title: Media Specialist
job.description:
AppVault specializes in groundbreaking recruitment software solutions providing a holistic approach to engaging, hiring, and retaining talent. We take steps to fully understand a client’s culture, messaging, and brand to provide cutting-edge recruitment SaaS based solutions to leading B2B brands around the country.

Our mission is to proactively support organizations by creating and distributing strategic multi-channel messaging to highly targeted audiences – communicating unique qualities and identifying the right candidates. Our team is comprised of dedicated and coordinated professionals – analysts, creators, supporters, and leaders – proficient in multitasking and committed to delivering.

About the Opportunity

The Media Specialist is an integral part of the media buying team through implementing and managing various paid digital media campaigns across clients of differing industries. The Media Specialist will work closely with the Media Team Lead to monitor campaigns and provide recommendations to the Customer Success team. In addition, the Media Specialist will gain knowledge of our product offerings and how they function alongside media campaigns.
  • Support the Media Team Lead with implementation and monitoring of campaigns across Google, Programmatic and Social Media
  • Provide recommendations and guidance to the client facing team as to how campaigns are performing and what can help increase performance
  • Day-to-day knowledge of campaign status
  • Ongoing research on best practices for each platform; keep up with advertising changes/rules/regulations
  • Be comfortable reporting findings to internal teams, potentially client-facing
  • Assist Customer Success team with monthly, quarterly and year-end client presentations
  • Become an expert in AppVault’s technology offerings
  • Endless opportunities – we are growing, join us!
  • Occasional travel involved

What You’ll Bring to the Table

The CSA identifies as a proactive, detail-oriented problem-solver that thrives in a fast-paced work environment and isn’t afraid of day-to-day challenges. If you are a collaborative go-getter who wants to be a customer advocate and partner closely with a scaling team to drive customer success, this is a great opportunity for you.
  • Minimum of 1-2+ years of Media Buying or Campaign Management Experience
  • BA/BS Bachelor’s degree
  • Certifications a Plus
  • Experience with Google Adwords, Programmatic Media and Paid Social Media a Plus
  • Diligent prioritization skills, strong multi-tasker & ability to adapt to constantly changing and unexpected deadlines
  • Experience working with a team
  • Obtain a solid understanding of our product offerings and how they benefit our clients’ recruitment strategies
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office

What We’ll Bring to the Table

We know you have a life outside of your job. That’s why we offer some great benefits. In addition to health insurance, 401K, and paid time off, we offer a hybrid work schedule, employee discounts, professional support, and the chance to work with some great people.

EOE M/F/D/V

job.title: Marketing Associate
job.description:
Core Responsibilities:

  • Identifying decision makers and key influencers within various types of organizations
  • Creating contact lists for on-going marketing campaigns
  • Contacting potential clients through cold calls and emails
  • Presenting our company with targeted product messaging to potential clients
  • Scheduling introduction calls with qualified companies

Job Overview

AppVault is looking for a Marketing Associate to act as the liaison between our Product, Communications and Sales teams. Your role will be to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers.

To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas. You will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you successfully transition the opportunity with the sales team.

If you are self-motivated and results-driven, and enjoy working in a team environment, we’d like to meet you. As a Marketing Associate, your role will help boost sales opportunities and contribute to our long-term business growth. Below is a brief summary of your day-to-day responsibilities:

  • Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market
  • Research and qualify companies as potential sales opportunities
  • Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails
  • Deliver targeted messaging specific to AppVault’s suite of recruitment technology
  • Presenting our company with targeted product messaging to potential clients
  • Build long-term trusting relationships with clients
  • Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) clients and Sales Team
  • Report to the Sales Team on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) campaign results
  • Stay up-to-date with new products/services and new pricing/payment plans

Requirements

  • Excellent phone, writing, and listening skills
  • Self-starter who has a desire to learn, grow, and excel in their role
  • Knowledge of business processes and organizational structures
  • Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls)
  • Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce)
  • Familiarity with Power Point and MS Excel (analyzing spreadsheets and charts)
  • Understanding of sales performance metrics
  • Interest in Recruitment Marketing Technology
  • At least one year of professional experience
  • BS degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field

Desired qualifications:

  • Experience reaching or exceeding scheduling activity goals/quotas
  • Familiarity with Recruitment Marketing Technology
  • Basic understanding of Talent Acquisition and general Recruitment process.

About AppVault

AppVault is a recruitment marketing technology and media services company. Our mission is to help companies hire more efficiently and effectively by humanizing the candidate experience.
  • Reach Your Target Audience
  • Engage Qualified Candidates
  • Connect & Nurture Relationships
  • Hire The Best Employees

job.title: Growth Hacker (Cork, Ireland)
job.description:
This role blends marketing and software engineering. You will grow the business through SEO, growth hacks, digital marketing and traditional marketing channels. Our tech stack is SQL, MySQL, and .Net. AppVault is located in Atlanta, GA but we are open to remote work.

ROLE

As our first Growth Hacker you will…

  • Identify the most profitable and engaged customers and providers (our “target users”)
  • Identify and manage the most profitable, scalable channels that generate target users
  • Identify and tweak the value propositions that convert target users
  • Craft and manage retention programs that engage existing users, drive purchase frequency and increase word of mouth
  • Maintain and report detailed models that evaluate effectiveness of marketing and retention efforts Requirements
  • 2+ years experience in a growth hacker / software engineering role at a high growth B2B start-up
  • 2+ years experience with SEO
  • BS in Computer Science or relevant experience
  • Solid experience with C# ASP.Net and .Net Core
  • Quantifiable proof of success from previous experience
  • Experience reverse engineering undocumented/private APIs
  • Bonus: Browser automation
  • Bonus: Amplitude, Grow, Customer.IO, Facebook Ads, Google Ads
  • Bonus: Understanding of more lower level computing paradigms

Benefits

  • Free parking
  • Small, enthusiastic team in high-growth environment
  • Healthcare
  • Unlimited vacation

job.title: Account Executive (Cork, Ireland)
job.description:
Reporting to the European Client Service Director, you will have responsibility for online media campaign delivery across paid and organic channels including Facebook, Twitter, Google, Youtube and SEO. The successful candidate will assist with the acquisition, conversion and retention of customers.

What will you be doing?

  • Drive acquisition of new customers through marketing channels such as paid search, display advertising, paid social media and SEO
  • Create campaigns to promote Matchbooks USPs, product and offers to current and prospective customers
  • Manage and optimise paid media campaigns and strategies
  • Serve as the day-to-day contact for 3rd party media agency resources
  • Manage the relationship between the company and advertising operators such as Google, Facebook, and Twitter
  • Manage budget and spend and report on performance

What are we looking for?

  • 1-3 yrs. online marketing experience with proven experience in an online marketing role
  • Experience optimising websites for SEO
  • Excellent knowledge of tools such as Google Analytics, Adwords, Facebook Ads Manager and Twitter Advertising
  • Experience of using CMS and managing a content roadmap
  • Analytical, numerate, attention to detail and excellent Excel skills
  • Track record of building successful digital campaigns
  • Knowledge of various attribution models and approaches for customer tracking

Bonus points for:

  • Interest in sports and sports betting
  • Ability to run a marathon at a moment's notice
